page.title: 15The Sawmill-2
page.content:
{Conservation}is also important on the estate.
Every year{10 acres of new trees}are planted. Fences have to be erected to keep out deer which would damage the young trees. A{gamekeeper}is employed by the estate to keep down the pests such as{rabbits}which would eat the very young trees.
The estate grows mainly{softwoods}such as{Spruce, Pine and Larch.}In the making of the finished product a great deal of waste wood is left. The smaller the size of the product, the smaller the size of the waste wood. This waste wood is very hard to dispose of. Most of the waste wood is sold to firewood merchants who in turn sell it the public.
